content: The Act may be cited as the "Agricultural Energy Programs Reauthorization Act of 2017". The Act includes a section on the Biobased Markets Program. Section 9002 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include renewable chemicals in the biobased products labeling program. The Secretary will provide education and outreach to stakeholders regarding the voluntary labeling program. The amendment includes developing NAICS codes for renewable chemicals and biobased products manufacturers, and establishing a national testing center registry. Subsection (h)(2) is also modified to include additional requirements. The amendment includes increasing funding for biobased products procurement and expanding the types of products included in the program. SEC. 3. Assistance for biorefinery, renewable chemical, and biobased product manufacturing. Section 9003 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include renewable chemical or biobased product technology in biorefineries. Mandatory funding from the Commodity Credit Corporation will be used for loan guarantees under this section. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include renewable chemical or biobased product technology in biorefineries. Mandatory funding from the Commodity Credit Corporation will be used for loan guarantees totaling $75,000,000 annually from 2019 to 2023. SEC. 4 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to allocate $5,000,000 annually for advanced biofuels from 2018 to 2023. SEC. 5 establishes the Rural Energy for America Program. The definition of a renewable energy system under the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include components necessary for energy distribution and storage. SEC. 6 amends the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act to allocate $20,000,000 annually for biomass research from 2019 to 2023. SEC. 7 extends the Feedstock Flexibility Program for bioenergy producers until 2023. SEC. 8 establishes a program for biofuels and biobased product feedstock and wildland fire protection.
